CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 6, 1956, pg. 3, reads: "Landmark of the 20's - Opened in early 20's by the city of Pittsburgh to serve a congested community, Crawford Recreation Center is now being razed to make room for renaissance of the Lower Hill.  The center attracted attention in sports under 'Jim' Dorsey and Harry Hall, and art under John Gore.  It was the spawning site in 1927 for the nationally known Pittsburgh Crawfords Baseball Club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Demolition of Crawford Recreation Center, enclosed by fence of doors, Hill District
